## ğŸ¤ Our Standards

- Be respectful and inclusive â€” no harassment or discrimination  
- Assume good intent; provide constructive feedback  
- Accept critique gracefully; disagree without hostility  
- Collaborate openly and transparently  
- Recognize contributions from all community members  

---

## ğŸš« Unacceptable Behavior

- Harassment, insults, or derogatory comments  
- Discriminatory language or exclusionary behavior  
- Public or private intimidation, stalking, or threats  
- Disruptive trolling or deliberate derailment of discussions  
- Sharing sensitive information without consent  

---

## ğŸ“‘ Community Expectations

Kansas-Frontier-Matrix builds on both **Contributor Covenant** and **MCP principles**:

- **Reproducibility first** â†’ every dataset, experiment, or workflow must be documented & reproducible  
- **Documentation-driven development** â†’ README files, SOPs, schemas as living lab notebooks  
- **Provenance matters** â†’ checksums, STAC metadata, logs ensure traceability  
- **Transparency** â†’ roadmap, governance, design discussions happen in issues/PRs  
- **Respect for history & culture** â†’ Indigenous perspectives, oral traditions, archival integrity  
- **Collaboration over competition** â†’ contributors, reviewers, maintainers work as peers

ğŸ§­ Maintainer Guidelines

Maintainers are expected to model MCP values:
	â€¢	Documentation-first â†’ all features/workflows must include README/schema
	â€¢	Reproducibility â†’ changes regenerable via make targets, avoid one-offs
	â€¢	Provenance â†’ new data requires checksums, STAC, metadata sidecars
	â€¢	CI hygiene â†’ workflows pinned & least-privilege, outputs validated
	â€¢	Transparency â†’ design/governance decisions logged in issues/PRs
	â€¢	Mentorship â†’ guide contributors in schemas, provenance, docs
	â€¢	Consistency â†’ enforce branch protection, rigorous reviews, coding standards

â¸»

âš™ï¸ How This Links to CI

Contributor behavior & MCP alignment directly affect automation:
	â€¢	Respectful, well-documented contributions â†’ faster reviews & merges
	â€¢	Reproducibility & provenance â†’ fewer CI failures (stac-validate, schema checks, hashes)
	â€¢	CI hygiene â†’ automerge eligibility once all required checks pass
	â€¢	Transparency in PRs â†’ better roadmap syncing & milestone tracking

ğŸ‘‰ Good conduct = smoother pipelines = faster integration.
